isis.stitle: 9 SPEED AND 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON 16709 AND 16710 SERIES - INSTALL - RIGHT COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

note.para: The left countershaft assembly MUST remain in time with the main drive gear when timing the right countershaft assembly.

step1.para: Remove the blocking from the right countershaft assembly and place it parallel to the mainshaft assembly. Mesh the marked tooth of the right countershaft drive gear with the remaining set of two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 188).
Insert the countershaft support tool or blocking in the rear bearing bore ( Figure 189).

Position the front countershaft bearing in its bore and install it with the proper bearing driver ( left, Figure 190). Install the retaining washer and bolt, making sure to align the pin in the shaft. Tighten the bolt to 90 to 120 ft-lbs. (122 to 163 N• m) (right).

figure.caption: Figure 190. Align Pin To The Shaft

step1.para: Move the reverse gear to the rear on the mainshaft and use a screwdriver to engage the sliding clutches with all forward speed gears ( Figure 191). A sliding clutch that will not engage with a gear indicates the gear set is not in proper mesh. The bearings of the right countershaft would then need to be removed and the drive gear set retimed.

figure.caption: Figure 191. Reverse Gear To Rear On Mainshaft

note.para: Do not engage sliding clutches with more than one gear at the same time. This will lock the gearing and prevent the mainshaft and countershaft assemblies from rotating.
